poem:
Title: An Ode to the Unsung

Desmond Miller, brave and bright,
Led the ink's rebellious fight,
Sheffield Anarchist saw light,
In Yorkshire's day, where once was night.

A secondhand press, a London drive,
His uncommon spirit kept alive,
In the student co-op, a lone star,
Without Des, we'd not come this far.

A hero unsung, in revolution's thread,
In our hearts, he is far from dead.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Letter: Desmond Miller obituary Desmond Miller was an unsung hero of the counterculture revolution as it made itself felt in Yorkshire in the early 1970s. Without Des the Leeds Other Paper and the Sheffield Anarchist would not have seen the light of day. He and I drove down to London from Leeds to collect a secondhand printing press. Not only was he one of the few people in the mainly student co-op who could drive,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
